name: Gingersnap-Cream Cookie Cups
author: larkspur
summary: These cute cookie cups are so pretty and tasty that no one will even suspect that they contain whole wheat flour! Topped off with a smooth cream cheese filling, these cookies are sure to impress!
ingredients: 1 small bunch fresh mint leaves, or as desired
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Combine oil, molasses, and eggs in a large bowl
Combine whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, sugar, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl
Stir into egg mixture until well combined
Place balls into the prepared muffin cups
Press dough up the sides of the cups using your fingers or a wooden spoon handle
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer doughy but still soft and edges are set, 10 to 15 minutes
Gently reform the holes in each cookie cup using a wooden spoon handle
Remove cookie cups from the pans and transfer to wire racks to cool completely, 15 to 30 minutes
Beat Neufchatel cheese in a medium bowl using an electric mixer until fluffy
Beat in confectioners' sugar and vanilla extract
Spoon filling into a pastry bag; pipe into each cooled cookie cup
Garnish each cookie cup with a mint sprig
